item.title: A tree-mendous holiday
item.description:
20190426-A tree-mendous holiday
下载此壁纸（1920x1080）

A Chinese proverb advises, “The best time to plant a tree is 20 years ago. The second-best time is now.” That’s especially true today. It’s National Arbor Day in the US and we’re featuring this dramatic photo of coast redwoods to remind you of the incredible power and importance of trees. The very first recorded Arbor Day took place in 1594 in the little village of Mondoñedo in Spain organized by its mayor. The first US Arbor Day was organized by journalist and politician Julius Sterling Morton in Nebraska City, Nebraska, on April 10, 1872 when celebrants planted an estimated 1 million trees in the Nebraska Territory.
